721621f-a.title: Manhattan: Market Slip - Cherry Street
721621f-a.text:
Market Slip, west side, north from and inc uding Water, to and includ-
ing Cherry Streets. Also shown is Water Street, at, adjoining and west o
the N.W. corner of Market Slip. Structual frame work for Knickerbocker
Village appears in the background.
March 6, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
The white corner structure, (No. 98 Market S1ip), the one story
garage adjacent and five story tenement (No. 428 Water Street) are
to be demolished by the New York City Housing Authority, according
to the New York Sun of September 12, 1938.
721621f-a.folder: Market Slip & Cherry Street, Manhattan, NY

731139f-a.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - [Ceremony of marking demolition of Lower east side tenements - Governor Alfred E. Smith.]
731139f-a.text:
Celebrations; Ceremonies corner 2herry and karket Streets,
marking demolition OGf Lower East side tenements. Sovenor
A1Crod E. Tith struck the first blow.Buildings will
be replaced with model Housing devolopments.
4ssociated Press Photo.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE.  October 14, 1933.
731139f-a.folder: Cherry Street and Market Street, Manhattan, N.Y.

718715f-a.title: Manhattan: Cherry Street - Market Street
718715f-a.text:
176-178 Cherry Street, north side, east of Market Street. Building
shown is a 1-story frame structure, with a small portion (178) of brick.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 13.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTION3.

721620f-a.title: Manhattan: Market Slip - Cherry Street
721620f-a.text:
84-90 Market Slip, east side, skuth from Cherry, to, and including
Water Streets. This building, formerly occupied by the White Dental Co.
has been converted into a Music School under the auspices of the Madonna
House; a Roman Catholic organization occuping the adjoining structure on
Cherry Street; No. 171. On the extreme right appears No. 433 Water St.,
a 5 story building at the S. E. corner Market Slip. The Manhattan Bridge
traverses the entire background.
August 16, i935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
721620f-a.folder: Market Slip & Cherry Street, Manhattan, NY

718710f-a.title: Manhattan: Cherry Street - Market Street
718710f-a.text:
171-187 Cherry Street, south side, east from, but not including Market
Slip, to the Manhattan Bridge. Nos. 171-173 is the Madonna House,a Roman
Catholic Retreat.
September 7, 1927.
L. Sperr.
NO REPPODUCTIONS.
No. 173 Cherry Street, the private residence with the statue
of the Madonna over the door is the former home of Alexander
Hamilton. For an aocount of a visit to this Nunnery and
an insight into it's activities, see the N. Y. Times of March
4th, 1940 page 12: ''About New York'' by Meyer Berger.
718710f-a.folder: Cherry Street & Market Street, Manhattan, NY
